author: Anonymous Calc
title: Final
question:
Hi
I just afraid I might fail this course again because I have take the course once in term one. Is there any chance I can pass this course :(
Thanks
student_answer:
@866:
If you are concerned about how you are doing I suggest you go to instructor office hours.  We can help you assess how things are going and come up with a plan to do better.
If you’ve already taken this course once, I would suggest that you review your notes, review what you did not do well on, and — seriously — reflect on what happened, after the course has ended. There’s no use crying over spilled milk during final exam season. Contacting instructors after Midterm 1 and Midterm 2 would have been good steps to ensure that you were on the right track. In addition, go to TA office hours — during exam season. There are resources in this course to help you succeed — but you must reach out for them.
Failing a course is not indicative of anything. Failing it twice may indicate that perhaps some reflection was not done. No course is designed to set you up for failure. Take these lessons to heart. Sometimes, the most profound life lessons that one learns are from the most painful experiences.
Of course, it’s up to you to choose what is important at this stage in the course. Do you weigh CPSC 110 heavier than your other courses to pass — and also sacrifice time on your other courses? The choice is up to you.
Good luck!
